recipe.name: Pastry Dough, Food Processor
recipe.notes: I have a dough blender and its kind of sexy to create dough from scratch but the food processor does a nice job and its ever so much simpler to deal with.

ingredient.preparation: cut into 1/2" pieces and well chilled

recipe.preparation: Process flour, salt and baking powder for 10 seconds to integrate.  Add unsalted butter and shortening and five 15-20 short pulses until mixture resembles coarse corn meal.  Any balls of butter should be no larger than a pea.  Sprinke half the ice water and pulse 5-6 times.  Add enough ice water to create a dough that will hold together but not to be sticky.  Do not allough dough to form a ball in the mixer.Turn the dough out into a floured surface and roll into a ball.  Flatten dough into a 6" disc and refrigerate for at least one hour before rolling out to 1/8" for use.Dough will keep 3 days refrigerated or up to a month in the freezer.
recipe.source_name: Cuisinart Food Processor Instruction and Recipe Booklet
